summary: This bill, the Restoring the Armed Career Criminal Act, amends Title 18 of the United States Code concerning the sentencing of armed career criminals. It modifies Section 924 by changing the offenses to which it applies and revising the penalties for individuals with three or more previous serious felony convictions who violate Section 922(g). The bill mandates a minimum prison sentence of 15 years and a maximum of 30 years and clarifies the definition of "serious felony conviction." It applies to offenses committed after the bill's enactment and limits opportunities to challenge sentences imposed under the amended section.
